No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Can you also generalize `le_iSup`, `iSup_le_iff`, and `iSup_le` in the analogous manner? That would ensure consistency across these four functions.

`le_iSup` became a bit worse at filling in the function argument which is unfortunate, and besides that there are a bunch of similarly generalizable lemmas in this file that I'll deal with in a seperate PR (tomorrow if I have time).
I think it'd be good to have all this as a single PR. You can close this one and keep the other one open as is.
Wait, the `UnivLE` API can be used to construct a `Small.{max u v, u}` instance? I was under the impression this just didn't work, if it does then that's awesome!
